item.title: Layer Model with Greenhouse Effect
item.description: Explanation ![[images/climate modeling/greenhouseeffect1.svg]] The figure above depicts the previously described [[posts/naked planet climate model|first basic climate model with bare-rock surface]]. The incoming energy budget is represented by $L(1 - \alpha)/4$ in the figure, where L is the solar constant, Î± is the albedo of Earth, and number 4 represents the geometry of the system (we’re considering the entire planet, so it’s a sphere, keep this in mind because we’ll deal with different problems that consider different conditions).

item.title: Naked Planet Climate Model
item.description: ![[images/climate modeling/naked planet climate model.svg]] The figure above depicts the most basic types of energy for a simple climate model. We have sunlight coming from the Sun in one direction, towards the Earth.

item.title: [PROJECT] Predict the weather using Machine Learning
item.description: Github link: https://github.com/thdngan/weatherML In this little project, I followed the instructions from the Predict The Weather with Machine Learning project from Dataquest.

item.title: What is heat and how can you warm up something in space

item.title: Sampling and Quantization in Image Processing
item.description: Images mentioned in this post are from Digital Image Processing (3rd edition), by Rafael C. Gonzalez, Richard E. Woods. I don’t have the permission to use them here.
